acute_aquatic_toxicity.hazard_name: Hazardous to the aquatic environment Acute
acute_aquatic_toxicity.rationale: It was classified into Not classified from 96 hours LC50=135mg/L of the fish (Bluegill) (CERI Hazard Data, 2002).

acute_toxicity_dermal.rationale: The substance is not classified due to lack of data suggesting acute effects on human health, though a LD50 value of 5,000mg/kg was obtained from an acute toxicity study on rabbits by the dermal route (CERI Hazard Data 2000-46 (2001)).

acute_toxicity_inhalation_dust.hazard_name: Acute toxicity Inhalation: Dusts and mists

acute_toxicity_inhalation_gas.rationale: Due to the fact that the substance is "liquid" according to the GHS definition and inhalation of its gas is not expected.

acute_toxicity_inhalation_vapor.rationale: Based on the LD50 (4 hours) value of 26,600ppm, calculated from the testing data of mouse LC50 (6-hour inhalation) of 21,723ppm (ACGIH (7th, 2001)), was lower than 90% of the saturated vapour concentration (264,000ppm) under a saturated vapour pressure of 26.7kPa (20degC), the substance was "Not classified" based on standard values expressed in ppm.

acute_toxicity_oral.rationale: Based on the LD50 value of 1,392mg/kg calculated from the testing data of rat LD50 (oral route) of 1,235mg/kg (MOE Risk Assessment vol. 2 (2003)), 1,275mg/kg (ACGIH (7th, 2001)), 7,900mg/kg (ATSDR (1997)) and 10,000mg/kg (ATSDR (1997)).

chronic_aquatic_toxicity.hazard_name: Hazardous to the aquatic environment Long-term
chronic_aquatic_toxicity.rationale: Since it was not water-insolubility (the water-solubility =4520mg/L (PHYSPROP Database, 2005)), and acute toxicity was low, it was classified into Not classified.

corrosive_to_metals.rationale: Test methods applicable to gas substances are not available (boiling point: 48.7degC (Lide, 84th, 2003), test temperature: 55degC)

explosives.rationale: Containing no chemical groups with explosive properties

flammable_gases.hazard_name: Flammable gases including chemically unstable gases
flammable_gases.rationale: Classified as "liquid" according to GHS definition

flammable_liquids.rationale: The flash point is 2-4degC (c.c.) (ICSC (2003)) and the boiling point is 48.7degC (Lide (84th, 2003)), which is classified into Category 2. Classified as Class 3 and Packing Group II (UN#1150: 1,2-dichloroethylene) (UN Recommendations on the Transport of Dangerous Goods)

flammable_solids.rationale: Classified as "liquid" according to GHS definition

gases_under_pressure.rationale: Classified as "liquid" according to GHS definition

germ_cell_mutagenicity.rationale: Based on the absence of data on multi-generation mutagenicity tests and germ cell mutagenicity tests in vivo, and negative data on somatic cell mutagenicity tests in vivo (micronucleus tests, chromosome aberration tests), described in NTP TR55 (2002), ATSDR (1996) and CERI Hazard Data 2000-46 (2001).

oxidizing_gases.rationale: Classified as "liquid" according to GHS definition

oxidizing_liquids.rationale: Organic compounds containing chlorine (but not oxygen and fluorine), with the chlorine bound to carbon and hydrogen (but not to other elements).

oxidizing_solids.rationale: Classified as "liquid" according to GHS definition

pyrophoric_liquids.rationale: Not pyrophoric when in contact with air at ordinary temperatures: the auto-ignition temperature is 460degC (1,2-dichloroethylene (ICSC, 2003).

pyrophoric_solids.rationale: Classified as "liquid" according to GHS definition

reproductive_toxicity.rationale: Classification not possible due to the insufficiency of data (with no data available on reproductive toxicity).

self_heating_substances.rationale: Test methods applicable to liquid substances are not available

self_reactive_substances.rationale: No data available, though containing unsaturated bonds. Classified as Class 3 (UN#1150: 1,2-dichloroethylene) (UN Recommendations on the Transport of Dangerous Goods)

serious_eye_damage_irritation.rationale: Based on the evidence of "moderate irritation" from human epidemiological studies (MOE Risk Assessment vol. 2 (2003)) and rabbit eye irritation tests (CERI Hazard Data 2000-46 (2001)).

skin_corrosion_irritation.rationale: Based on the evidence of "moderate skin irritation" from the rabbit skin irritation tests (CERI Hazard Data 2000-46 (2001)), though the results are not those of 4-hour application.

substances_mixtures_emit_flammable_gas_i.hazard_name: Substances and mixtures which, in contact with water, emit flammable gases
substances_mixtures_emit_flammable_gas_i.rationale: Containing no metals or metalloids (B, Si, P, Ge, As, Se, Sn, Sb, Te, Bi, Po, At)

systemic_toxicity_repeat_exposure.hazard_name: Specific target organ toxicity - Repeated exposure
systemic_toxicity_repeat_exposure.hazard_statement: May cause damage to organs through prolonged or repeated exposure (respiratory system)
systemic_toxicity_repeat_exposure.rationale: Based on the evidence from animal studies including "cellular infiltration in the lung" (IRIS (1998)).  The effects on experimental animals were observed at dosing levels within the guidance value ranges for Category 2.

systemic_toxicity_single_exposure.classification:
Category 1 (central nervous system, liver),
Category 2 (heart, respiratory system),
Category 3 (narcotic effects)
systemic_toxicity_single_exposure.hazard_name: Specific target organ toxicity - Single exposure
systemic_toxicity_single_exposure.hazard_statement:
Causes damage to organs (central nervous system, liver)
May cause damage to organs (heart, respiratory system)
May cause drowsiness or dizziness (narcotic effects)
systemic_toxicity_single_exposure.rationale: Based on the human evidence including "nausea, drowsiness, fatigue, dizziness, increased ICP" (ATSDR (1996)), and the evidence from animal studies including "fibrous swelling/congestion of the cardiac muscle, fat accumulation to the hepatic lobule and Kupffer cells, congestion of the pulmonary capillaries and dilatation of the alveolar wall" (ATSDR (1996)). The effects on experimental animals were observed at dosing levels within the guidance value ranges for Categories 1 and 2.
